required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HOPE in Action Prospective Multicenter, Clinical Trial of Deceased HIVD+ Kidney Transplants for HIV+ Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: HOPE in Action Prospective Multicenter, Clinical Trial of Deceased HIVD+ Kidney Transplants for HIV+ Recipients

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to determine if an HIV-infected deceased kidney donor (HIVD+) transplant is safe with regards to major transplant-related and HIV-related complications.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will evaluate if receiving a kidney transplant from an HIV-infected deceased kidney donor is safe with regards to survival and major transplant-related and HIV-related complications compared to receiving a kidney from an HIV-uninfected deceased kidney donor (HIVD-). Those participants who have accepted an HIVD- organ will be randomized to be followed in the full study or followed in the nested observational group.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite event, time to first death or graft failure or serious adverse event (SAE) or HIV breakthrough or opportunistic infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through administrative censorship at study completion, up to 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Time to first of any of the following events: death or graft failure or serious adverse event (SAE) or HIV breakthrough or opportunistic infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment to date of transplant or death of any cause, whichever comes first, assessed up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to mortality while enrolled before transplant (survival framework)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through administrative censorship at study completion, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to mortality or re-transplant or return to maintenance dialysis (survival framework)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through graft failure or administrative censorship at study completion, up to year 4
secondary_outcome.description: Count of post-transplant serious adverse events per person-year as assessed by Division of AIDS (DAIDS) Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events, Version 2.0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant to end of month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of recipients who experience acute rejection as measured by biopsy using Banff 2015 criteria: Borderline changes: 'Suspicious' for acute T-cell mediated rejection.This category is used when no intimal arteritis is present, but there are foci of mild tubulitis (t1, t2, or t3) with minor interstitial infiltration (i0 or i1) or interstitial infiltration (i2, i3) with mild (t1) tubulitis. Acute T-cell mediated rejection:Grade from IA defined as cases with significant interstitial infiltration (>25% of parenchyma affected, i2 or i3) and foci of moderate tubulitis (t2) to III defined as cases with 'transmural' arteritis and/or arterial fibrinoid change and necrosis of medial smooth muscle cells with accompanying lymphocytic inflammation (v3)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant to end of year 1
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of recipients who experience acute rejection as measured by biopsy using Banff 2015 criteria: Borderline changes: 'Suspicious' for acute T-cell mediated rejection.This category is used when no intimal arteritis is present, but there are foci of mild tubulitis (t1, t2, or t3) with minor interstitial infiltration (i0 or i1) or interstitial infiltration (i2, i3) with mild (t1) tubulitis. Acute T-cell mediated rejection:Grade from IA defined as cases with significant interstitial infiltration (>25% of parenchyma affected, i2 or i3) and foci of moderate tubulitis (t2) to III defined as cases with 'transmural' arteritis and/or arterial fibrinoid change and necrosis of medial smooth muscle cells with accompanying lymphocytic inflammation (v3)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through administrative censorship, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of acute rejection (survival framework) as measured by biopsy using Banff 2015 criteria: Borderline changes: 'Suspicious' for acute T-cell mediated rejection.This category is used when no intimal arteritis is present, but there are foci of mild tubulitis (t1, t2, or t3) with minor interstitial infiltration (i0 or i1) or interstitial infiltration (i2, i3) with mild (t1) tubulitis. Acute T-cell mediated rejection:Grade from IA defined as cases with significant interstitial infiltration (>25% of parenchyma affected, i2 or i3) and foci of moderate tubulitis (t2) to III defined as cases with 'transmural' arteritis and/or arterial fibrinoid change and necrosis of medial smooth muscle cells with accompanying lymphocytic inflammation (v3)

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of transplant recipients with glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of transplant recipients with glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of transplant recipients with glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2

secondary_outcome.measure: Trajectory of recipient plasma HIV RNA over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of repeated measures of plasma HIV RNA (longitudinal model)

secondary_outcome.measure: Trajectory of recipient Cluster of Differentiation (CD4) count over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of repeated measures of Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) count (longitudinal model)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by local sites' Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) certified lab with episode of HIV breakthrough defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV viral loads >200 copies/mL or one HIV viral load >1000 copies/mL after a period of virologic control post-transplant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by local sites' Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) certified lab with episode of HIV breakthrough defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV viral loads >200 copies/mL or one HIV viral load >1000 copies/mL after a period of virologic control post-transplant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of opportunistic infections

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through year 1
secondary_outcome.description: Number of surgical complications within 1 year of transplant, e.g. delayed closure, wound dehiscence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through year 1
secondary_outcome.description: Number of vascular complications within 1 year of transplant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of malignancies as determined by local pathology

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the formation of de novo donor-specific human leukocyte antigen(HLA) antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of year 1
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with a de novo donor-specific HLA antibody as measured and reported by local sites' lab

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of transplant through end of follow-up, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first of any of these events: all-cause-mortality or graft failure or renal allograft rejection or HIV breakthrough or HIV virologic failure or AIDS defining illness

arm_group.description: HIV-infected individuals that accept an organ from an HIV-infected deceased donor - enrollment 80
HIV-infected individuals that accept an organ from an HIV-uninfected deceased donor -enrollment 80
HIV-infected individuals that accept an organ from an HIV-uninfected deceased donor and randomized to observational group - enrollment 200

intervention.description: Kidney from an HIV-infected deceased donor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant meets the standard criteria for kidney transplant at the local center.
- Participant is able to understand and provide informed consent.
- Participant meets with an independent advocate per the HIV Organ Policy Equity (HOPE) Act Safeguards.
- Documented HIV infection (by any licensed assay, or documented history of detectable HIV-1 RNA).
- No living donor available.
- Participant is ≥18 years old.
- Opportunistic complications: if prior history of an opportunistic infection, the participant has received appropriate therapy and has no evidence of active disease.
- Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4)+ T-cell: ≥200/µL within 16 weeks of transplant.
- HIV-1 is below 50 copies RNA/mL. Viral blips between 50-400 copies allowed as long as there are not consecutive measurements >200 copies/mL.
- Participant is willing to comply with all medication related to their transplant and HIV management.
- For participant with a history of aspergillus colonization or disease, no evidence of active disease.
- The participant must have, or be willing to start seeing, a primary medical care provider with expertise in HIV management.
- All participants participating in sexual activity that could lead to pregnancy must use an FDA approved method of birth control.
- Participant is not suffering from significant wasting (e.g. body mass index <21) thought to be related to HIV disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has a history of progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) or primary central nervous system (CNS) lymphoma.
- Participant is pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Past or current medical problems or findings from medical history, physical examination or laboratory testing that are not listed above, which, in the opinion of the investigator, may pose additional risks or may impact the quality or interpretation of the data obtained from the study.

facility.name: University of Maryland, Institute of Human Virology
Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
